remarks: Series product with index set a subset of the upper integers. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 5-Dec-2017.)
statement:
zprod.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
zprod.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
zprod.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. Z E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , F ) ~~> y ) ) $.
zprod.4 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ Z ) $.
zprod.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = if ( k e. A , B , 1 ) ) $.
zprod.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. CC ) $.
zprod $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. A B = ( ~~> ` seq M ( x. , F ) ) ) $.
$d A k n $.
$d A k n $.
$d A k n y $.
$d B n $.
$d B n $.
$d B n y $.
$d F k $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d M k $.
$d M k y $.
$d Z n $.
$d k n ph $.
$d ph y $.
